spirals.title: DataCite Metadata Schema for the Publication and Citation of Research Data - Mandatory
spirals.description: The DataCite Metadata Schema is a list of core metadata properties chosen for the accurate and consistent identification of a resource for citation and retrieval purposes, along with recommended use instructions. The resource that is being identified can be of any kind, but it is typically a dataset. We use the term 'dataset' in its broadest sense. We mean it to include not only numerical data, but any other research data outputs.

items.name: Resource Identifier
items.description: Identifier for the resource described by the metadata

items.name: Resource Identifier Type
items.description: The type of identifier used to uniquely identify the resource.

items.name: Author / Originator
items.note: In CSW this concept is called Creator
items.description: The principal author of the resource

items.name: Author / Originator Identifier
items.description: A unique identifier for a resource author or originator

items.name: Author / Originator Identifier Type
items.description: The type of unique identifier for a resource author or originator

items.name: Resource Title
items.description: A short description of the resource. The title should be descriptive enough so that when a user is presented with a list of titles the general content of the data set can be determined.

items.name: Publisher
items.description: Publisher of the cited resource

items.name: Resource Creation/Revision Date
items.description: The date the resource was created

The resource that is being identified can be of any kind, but it is typically a dataset. We use the term 'dataset' in its broadest sense. We mean it to include not only numerical data, but any other research data outputs.

items.name: Theme Keyword
items.note: The general identification keywords usually have a type of theme and are refered to as theme keywords. Other types and vocabularies are used for other information. Service Entry Resource Format (SERF) requires a Science and a Service GCMD Keyword. This concept is called Subject in the CSW Specification.
items.description: A word or phrase that describes some aspect of a resource. Can be one of several types.

items.name: Keyword Vocabulary
items.note: DIF, ECHO and ECS require that theme keywords come from the Global Change Master Directory list.
items.description: If you are following a guideline or using a shared vocabulary for the words/phrases in your 'keywords' attribute, put the name of that guideline here.

items.name: Contributor Name
items.description: Contributor to the resource

items.name: Contributor Role
items.description: The role of any individuals or institutions that contributed to the creation of the data.

items.name: Responsible Party Identifier Type
items.description: The type of a unique identifier for a person or an organization

items.name: Responsible Party Identifier
items.description: A unique identifier for a person or an organization

items.name: Resource Creation/Revision Date
items.description: The date the resource was created

items.name: Resource Type
items.description: A resource code identifying the type of resource; e.g. dataset, a collection, an application (See MD_ScopeCode) for which the metadata describes.

items.name: Related Resource Identifier
items.description: Identifier for a resource related to the resource being described.

items.name: Abstract
items.note: This concept is called Desciption in Catalog Services for the Web.
items.description: A paragraph describing the resource.

items.name: Spatial Extent
items.description: The spatial extent of the resource.

items.name: Resource Language

items.name: Resource Identifier

items.name: Transfer Size

items.name: Resource Format

items.name: Resource Version

items.name: Rights
